input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.span: Weekly breakfast and lunch meals are available for ALL children under the age of 18. Everyone is eligible; there is no need to complete an application, or qualify for free and reduced lunch!

Food items can be picked up every Monday from 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm using the circle drive behind the middle school. Please contact Jan Friedrich at 614-579-8807 or jan.friedrich@libertyunion.org for more information.

li.a: Ohio Department of Education's Parent Resources

div.h2:
Empowering all students to
maximize their talents.

p.span: April 17, 2020
To All Connected to Liberty Union-Thurston Schools,

Next week will be a full week of online learning after this shortened week we have had due to Spring Break. If you are having trouble making an online learning schedule, please communicate that to your childs’ teacher so that he or she is both aware of your situation and can assist you.

This daily communication has been re-organized so that all NEW information is posted above the dotted line while previously posted information is below it. And, of course, all updates dating back to March 16th are posted on this link:

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Updated: April 17, 2020 at 3:00 P.M.

h3.a: No update today -- check back tomorrow

span.div: Also, check out all the past updates dating back to March 16th at this link: http://www.libertyunion.org/COVID-19Information.aspx

p.span: April 15, 2020
To All Connected to Liberty Union-Thurston Schools,

We at Liberty Union-Thurston Schools hope that everyone had an enjoyable and safe Spring Break from school. It is now time for students to re-engage with the learning opportunities that their teachers are assigning.
Updated: April 15, 2020 at 3:00 P.M.

h3.a: Reminders for April 13th - Live Streaming School Board Meeting and Food Service

p.style: color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
p.span: SCHOOL BOARD MEETING

p.style: color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
p.span: The Liberty Union-Thurston Local School Board will convene for its regularly scheduled meeting on Monday, April 13th at 7:00 P.M. In order to abide by the “stay at home” order from Governor Mike Dewine, the meeting will be live streamed for the public. To view the meeting in progress, please use this link at 7:00 P.M. on Monday the 13th

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.style: color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
p.span: FOOD SERVICE

p.style: color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
p.span: This is a reminder that food service is available for all children under the age of 18. E
veryone is eligible; there is no need to complete an application, or qualify for free and reduced lunches to receive this food.
Please contact
Jan Friedrich by email at

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: to provide the number of children under 18 in your household.

p.style: color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; text-indent: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; text-indent: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
p.span: A weekly allocation of meals will be ready for curbside pick every MONDAY from 4:00 to 6:00 P.M. behind the middle school building. There is also a Thurston pick up location from 4:30 P.M. to 5:30 P.M.

p.style: color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; text-indent: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; text-indent: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
p.span: Even though we are on Spring Break on Monday the 13th, we will STILL have weekly food pick up this day.

p.style: color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; text-indent: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
color: #272727;font-family:Source Sans Pro, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: #fafafa; line-height: 1.38; text-indent: 36pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt
p.span: The district will not be responsible for monitoring food allergies during this time. However, if your child has a severe allergy to peanut butter, please let us know, as we will routinely be using Uncrustables.

div.div: Today's resources will be about Zearn for grades K-5. Zearn is an online math resource that directly correlates with our Eureka Math curriculum and math standards.
Orient your Student with Zearn Math~https://youtu.be/gyxGAARinFY

p.span: April 9, 2020
To All Connected to Liberty Union-Thurston Schools,

Liberty Union-Thurston Local Schools will be on Spring Break from Friday, April 10th through Tuesday, April 14th. There should be no due dates on student work, teachers and staff may be slower to respond to requests, and we encourage all students, parents, and community members to disconnect from their computers and enjoy time with each other while remaining safe and healthy. The next update is planned for Wednesday, April 15th.
Updated: April 9, 2020 at 3:00 P.M.

div.span: Today's resources will be about Google Classroom. Google Classroom is the LU-T District's learning management system (LMS) for grades 2-12; some teachers even use Google Classroom as a communication tool with parents!

p.span: Updated: April 6, 2020 at 6:00 P.M.

div.span: A message from the Liberty Union-Thurston School Board President

p.span: Dear Liberty Union-Thurston Family,

I wanted to thank each of you again for your ongoing dedication and hard work through this difficult time. All of your efforts serve as an example to our community of the quality that we have at Liberty Union-Thurston Schools.
To All Connected to Liberty Union-Thurston Schools,

span.p: With the beginning of April, these daily updates will not have the general information that was posted all last month. However, you can always refer back to previous updates for that information. Link: http://www.libertyunion.org/COVID-19Information.aspx

h3.a: Read and Write for Google (Grades 2-12 ONLY)

span.style: background-color: #ffffff; color: #3c4043; font-family: Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 1rem; letter-spacing: 0.00625em; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: Read&Write for Google Chrome™ provides personalized support to make documents, web pages and common file types in Google Drive (including: Google Docs, PDF & ePub) more accessible. It’s designed to help everyone engage with digital content in a way that suits his/her abilities and learning styles.

span.style: font-family: inherit; background-color: #ffffff; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap

div.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff
font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: Today I am going to show you how to check your child’s i-Ready progress and ensure they are completing their required assignments for the week. i-Ready is a personalized instructional tool for reading and math in grades kindergarten through 8th-grade. For most students, the weekly expectation is to complete 45-60 minutes of i-Ready instruction and pass two lessons for each subject; please verify these expectations with your child’s teacher if he/she has not already communicated these weekly expectations with you and your child.

span.style: font-family: inherit; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: Hey there LU-T families! Mrs. Savage, our Instructional Technology Coach, is going to make daily (Monday-Friday) posts with short tutorial videos about the instructional tools students are using during their online/home learning opportunities.

div.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff
font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: The first tool we are going to highlight is Kami. Click on the video links to watch short tutorial videos about Kami. Click the More+ button to view the links to the videos.

p.span: March 25, 2020
Eighth Grade Parents and Students:

Due to the outbreak of COVID-19, the temporary closure of schools and CDC recommendations of social distancing, the idea of taking our students to Washington, D.C. in May is simply not reasonable. While this is disappointing for everyone involved, the health of our kids and community must be our top priority. It is for these reasons the trip to D.C. cannot happen this academic year. Therefore, the trip has been officially
rescheduled

h3.a: Letter from LU-T Board of Education President, Dr. John Walter

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dear Liberty Union-Thurston Family,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Sorry that I may be a bit late in expressing this but as you are all aware, this has not been a typical week. I want to thank each and every one of you for the way that you have met the challenge this current pandemic has created. I know myself and the rest of the Board of Education are grateful and proud of the way that our district family has responded.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: To the district administrators, principals and district office personnel: You can never know how appreciative we are by how you have coordinated responses to all the tasks that had to be addressed in an insane time frame. We get regular updates about where we stand with student activities and district issues. The letter that Mr. Gallatin sent out to the seniors was so touching because it addressed the disappointment that these students are experiencing while at the same time challenging them to make the best of the situation. From the elementary up to the high school, everyone should be proud of these senior students. They have been gracious and understanding and can serve as an example to all of us.

span.span: The Liberty Union-Thurston School District has created this webpage to serve as a "one stop shop" for all information related to the COVID-19 situation. Please check back to this page regularly for the most up to date information in this rapidly changing situation.

a.style: background-color: #ffffff; transition: color 0.5s ease 0s; user-select: auto; font-family: Roboto, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-decoration-line: none !important; outline: 0px !important

div.span: Governor Mike DeWine has announced closure of all K-12 public schools beginning Tuesday, March 17th through April 3, 2020. Schools are OPEN on Monday March 16th and it is imperative that students attend. Chromebooks and chargers will be distributed to all students on Monday March 16th during school hours. We will be using the District website and automated phone calling system to share all information while we are out of school during this time.
Dear Parents, Guardians and Community Members,

As more information is released from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) about the Coronavirus and its potential impact on our country, we want you to be aware that we are staying up-to-date on the latest information and we’re reviewing all of our public safety plans.
We know an outbreak in our region could impact schools, so we are preparing for many what-if scenarios to minimize disruption while keeping students and staff safe.
To view the full letter from Dr. Johnson, please follow this link:

Tickets for Liberty Union's Matilda are now on sale. Click on the link below to reserve your seats today!
https://www.showtix4u.com/event-details/37204

h3.a: Reese Shirey and the Columbus Blue Jackets!

span.span: Earlier this month, 11-year-old Reese Shirey was one of six

span.style: color: #383838; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; box-sizing: inherit

a.style: box-sizing: inherit; background-color: transparent; color: #383838; cursor: pointer; box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2) 0px -3px 0px inset; border-bottom: 3px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; transition: color 0.15s cubic-bezier(0.33, 0.66, 0.66, 1) 0s, background-color 0.15s cubic-bezier(0.33, 0.66, 0.66, 1) 0s, box-shadow 0.15s cubic-bezier(0.33, 0.66, 0.66, 1) 0s, border-bottom 0.15s cubic-bezier(0.33, 0.66, 0.66, 1) 0s

span.a: young cancer fighters invited to Nationwide Arena

span.span: to take part in a photo shoot with Blue Jackets players, all part of her designation as one of six cancer heroes this year for the organization during the annual Hockey Fights Cancer campaign.

span.div: A Surrogate Parent is an individual who is appointed by the school district of residence or a court to represent a student with a disability (1) whose parent cannot be identified or located, (2) who is a ward of the state, or (3) who is an unaccompanied homeless youth.

A five-hour comprehensive training is provided by State Support Teams (SSTs). Once completed, participants will be certified as surrogate parents, enabling them to represent a child in matters relating to the identification, evaluation and educational placement, and the provision of free and appropriate public education.

h3.a: Liberty Union-Thurston Schools Receive National Recognition

div.span: District Administration magazine is honoring 22 schools and districts for education technology initiatives as part of the Schools of TechXcellence program. This is the second year for this national recognition program.
